intro: Scyphostelma microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved scyphostelma, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a subtle ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species with conservation concerns. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
